intro: Tetratheca rupicola, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tetratheca rupicola is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
